think_procedure: To determine if the 'jit' knob in PostgreSQL is a 'special knob', first we need to understand what the 'jit' knob does. The 'jit' knob enables or disables Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation of SQL queries. It is a boolean setting where setting it to 'on' enables JIT and setting it to 'off' disables it. Since this knob is a boolean and does not have a range of numerical values, it doesn't fit the typical behavior of having special numerical values that break the natural order of the settings. Therefore, it does not qualify as a 'special knob' in the context of having a special numerical value that alters its regular operation significantly.
